image.altText: A man stands in yellow hi vis and a hard hat holding a lump of wet dirt

props.synopsis: Mining magnate Andrew Forrest says a move to slash 700 jobs from Fortescue is not a sign he is pulling away from his green hydrogen ambitions.

title.children: 'Twiggy is not walking back from hydrogen': Forrest plays down impact of Fortescue job cuts

image.altText: Office building entrance with sign saying Niche Living and glass doors

props.synopsis: A Perth home builder with scores of unfinished projects on the books is no longer able to legally undertake construction works.

title.children: Customers in limbo after Perth home builder loses legal authority to undertake construction works

image.altText: Arrest of sexual assault accused

props.synopsis: A pensioner accused of sexually assaulting two teenage girls more than 30 years ago is released on bail after being arrested in a cold case review.

title.children: Cold case review sees pensioner charged with sexually assaulting teen girls 30 years ago

image.altText: Luke Ryan reacts after Fremantle's loss to Hawthorn

props.synopsis: The AFL is investigating exactly what took place after Fremantle players were forced to fly home with no working toilets due to a plane running out of water half an hour into a four-hour journey.

title.children: 'Utterly unacceptable': Airline industry under fire after Fremantle flew for hours with no working toilets

image.altText: Hacking

props.synopsis: Online eScripts provider MediSecure has revealed 12.9 million Australians had personal data stolen in a cyber breach earlier this year, making it one of the largest data hacks in Australian history.

title.children: MediSecure reveals 12.9m Australians had personal data stolen in cyber attack

image.altText: A bespectacled woman and her 10yo daughter look solemnly at photos of a boy.

props.synopsis: Joey's family had just moved into their new rental home and were waiting for removalists to deliver their furniture, but when they arrived he had disappeared.

title.children: Joey Vines drowned quietly in a neighbour's pool. Years later, his family is finally smiling again

image.altText: A man sitting at a desk in front of a computer screen with one hand on the mouse

props.synopsis: The number of jobs in the country, and participation in the workforce, has risen, but so has the unemployment rate. Recruiters say a candidate's success depends on where they're looking for work.

title.children: 'I'd applied for 35 jobs and didn't get any': The brutal reality of finding work as unemployment rises

image.altText: Anthony Albanese press conference

props.synopsis: Amid growing pressure from state premiers, Labor's federal leaders have suspended its links to the construction division of the CFMEU, which has been engulfed in scandals in recent days.

title.children: Federal Labor bans donations, cuts ties with scandal-engulfed CFMEU

image.altText: JD Vance smiles as he delivers a speech on stage, his right hand on his chest

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's pick for vice president, JD Vance, addresses the Republican National Convention as US President Joe Biden tests positive for COVID-19. Follow live.

title.children: Trump's VP pick JD Vance addresses Republican convention, Biden catches COVID — as it happened

image.altText: Joe Biden shades his eyes with his right hand as he gives a speech from behind a presidential lectern.

props.synopsis: Newly minted vice-presidential candidate JD Vance stole the show at the Republican National Convention, while President Joe Biden's day took a rough turn.

title.children: Things go from bad to worse for Biden as Republicans party on: Key moments from a wild day in US politics

image.altText: A woman stands with her arms crossed in a paddock in front of a dead sheep.

props.synopsis: Nicole Daniels has lost dozens of sheep to the attacks which have occurred for three consecutive nights on her property in WA's Kojonup.

title.children: WA farmer loses dozens of sheep after three straight nights of dog attacks

image.altText: Workers say thank you to CFMEU leadership

props.synopsis: Dozens of union members appeared in the video, thanking CFMEU leadership in NSW for "always being at the cornerstone of safety on site".

title.children: 'Union power': NSW branch of CFMEU posts defiant video against government, ACTU and 'rotten media'

image.altText: A young woman holding a baby whose face has been blurred. A man sits next to them.

props.synopsis: Amber Haigh allegedly told her third cousin that Robert Geeves tied her up and performed sexual acts on her after he uncovered footage from a hidden camera, a court has heard.

title.children: Murder trial hears mum spoke of being tied up, assaulted after sex caught on hidden camera

image.altText: A West Coast AFL player lies on the ground after being tackled as a Brisbane forward lies on top of him.

props.synopsis: Brisbane Lions star Charlie Cameron sensationally has a three-match ban for a rough tackle on Liam Duggan overturned by the appeals board.

title.children: Cameron free to play as appeals board deems AFL tribunal 'put the cart before the horse'

image.altText: Anthony Albanese speaks at a podium inside parliament house

props.synopsis: The CFMEU saga has meant Anthony Albanese has again spent his week fielding questions about internal Labor matters, when he'd rather be talking about anything else.

title.children: Watching the government respond to the CFMEU saga is like watching a brakeless freight train heading for a crowded station

image.altText: A street sign for Davies Street.

props.synopsis: The wounded man is in a "sedated condition" and will be transferred to the Royal Hobart Hospital for ongoing treatment after being shot in the chest in George Town, in Tasmania's north overnight.

title.children: Man shot in the chest rode motorcycle to seek help, Tasmania police say

image.altText: A man in a fawn-coloured coat smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: The search history of Tasmanian Supreme Court judge Gregory Geason shows he visited webpage 'Phone tracker: Type in a phone number and find a location' while under a restraining order after the alleged assault of a woman.

title.children: Judge visits 'how to get domestic violence charges dropped — step-by-step' webpage after alleged assault, court hears

image.altText: A man walks into court wearing dark sunglasses and a blue shirt.

props.synopsis: Neil Mellon disclosed confidential information about a domestic violence incident to celebrity crocodile wrangler Matt Wright, newly released court documents have revealed.

title.children: Jailed former police officer leaked confidential information to Netflix star, court documents show

image.altText: Toyah Cordingley sits with her dogs.

props.synopsis: Rajwinder Singh was due to stand trial next week over the alleged murder of Toyah Cordingley on a Queensland beach almost six years ago. His counsel has secured a last minute delay.

title.children: Trial delayed six years after Toyah Cordingley was found dead on a Queensland beach

image.altText: Three small, round, yellow fruits rest in the palm of a hand.

props.synopsis: Stephen Reiffer is keen to show everyone that yuzu is so much more than just a little, yellow citrus fruit as chefs seek it out for everything from crayfish butter sauce to margaritas.

title.children: Farmer goes all in on 'ugly lemon' restaurants can't get enough of

image.altText: Construction site

props.synopsis: The lure of long-term employment on major construction sites has been one major factor in why home building has become so expensive.

title.children: Has the CFMEU made home building more expensive? Yes, but not how you think

image.altText: A generic photo of a hotel worker

props.synopsis: Australia's unemployment rate continues to edge higher, despite the creation of about 50,000, mostly full-time, jobs last month.

title.children: Unemployment edges up despite more than 50,000 extra jobs amid rapid population growth

image.altText: Grays

props.synopsis: The federal court orders auction company Grays to bear hefty penalties over 750 contraventions of consumer law, which saw it sell second-hand cars with false or misleading descriptions to consumers between 2020 and 2022.

title.children: Auction business Grays deceived used car buyers over two-year period, causing $3 million in consumer losses

image.altText: Thomas Cooks

props.synopsis: An FBI official tells senators there was no indication gunman Thomas Matthew Crooks had any strong political views or any co-conspirators, as agents work to piece together what led him to try to kill Donald Trump.

title.children: Would-be assassin looked up photos of Trump, Biden and a British royal, FBI tells senators

image.altText: Two smiling white men in suits flank a shorter woman in a pale blue suit, against a dark blue background.

props.synopsis: An Italian journalist is ordered to pay damages for social media posts reacting to a complaint by Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni about mocking her height.

title.children: Italian journalist fined $8k for 'body-shaming' Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni

image.altText: A court sketch of Kerrie Elizabeth Struhs, who has dark hair and wears a blue shirt.

props.synopsis: Elizabeth Struhs suffered diabetic ketoacidosis and died in her Rangeville home in January 2022 after her father Jason Struhs stopped her insulin injections.

title.children: Elizabeth Struhs's mother previously told jury her daughter's illness was 'given by God'

image.altText: Black and white picture of an Olympic stadium

props.synopsis: Modern Olympians might not compete naked or offer blood tributes to the gods. But there are a number of rituals you'll see at this year's Games that carry ancient religious roots.

title.children: We don't sacrifice animals at the Olympics anymore, but plenty of other ancient traditions remain

image.altText: Volleyballs generic

props.synopsis: The board of Volleyball Australia has issued an apology to former players who suffered through "an environment of fear," coercive control, physical and psychological abuse.

title.children: Volleyball Australia apologises to former players for physical and psychological abuse

image.altText: A father and son sitting next to each other, the father has his arm around his son.

props.synopsis: Stephen Gale, 56, and cameraman James Rose, 30, were killed after two Viper S-211 Marchetti planes crashed mid-air in November last year, during a formation flight.

title.children: Father of cameraman killed in plane collision last year says family is left with questions

image.altText: A man stands in a forest on a sunny day, looking into camera with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: Australia's largest super fund is investing money from its "Socially Aware" option in the coal, oil and gas industries, despite excluding shares and corporate bonds of companies with fossil fuel reserves.

title.children: AustralianSuper's ethical option investing in coal, oil and gas industries

image.altText: A police car parked in the middle of a deserted road with police tape stretched across it in the rear.

props.synopsis: A 20-year-old man is arrested and charged over a stabbing in South Perth which left another man in hospital with serious injuries and forced the closure of a section of Canning Highway.

title.children: Man due to face court over South Perth stabbing after being charged by police

image.altText: NSW Police

props.synopsis: The senior NSW police officer was charged late last year with driving under the influence of alcohol and high-range drink-driving, nearly six months after the incident.

title.children: 'Dark day' for NSW Police after damning report into detective's car crash in Sydney

image.altText: A Cobra spitting venom.

props.synopsis: Cobra venom could potentially be treated with a commonly prescribed blood thinner, new research has indicated.

title.children: Blood thinner could revolutionise treatment for cobra venom

image.altText: A male house sparrow, with brown and black markings around its face, sits on a tin fence.

props.synopsis: Sparrows are often considered pests, but a new study suggests lead levels in the birds' blood could indicate if children in mining towns have been exposed to high levels of the poisonous chemical.

title.children: Many Australian towns are contaminated by lead, but sparrows can predict if kids have lead poisoning
